p: That so great was the prejudice against defendant during said examination that several times when the public prosecutor vehemently de- nounced defendant the large crowd in attendance charged, stamped their feet in approval and when finally de- fendant was by said Justices held without bail for murder inthe first degree the large crowd of people in sttendance again manifested their approval by stompling their feet loudly, affiant further alleges upon information and belief that at that time large
